New Records: Virat Kohli overtook Sri Lankaâ€™s Mahela Jayawardene as the leading run-scorer in the history of the T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: KL Rahul scored 50 and ended his run drought
Litton Das scored 60 and gave Bangladesh a rollicking start
Bangladesh needed 20 from the last over from Arshdeep Singh but fell short
Suryakumar Yadav made a breezy 30 off 16 balls
Post-Match Reflections: India moved to top of Group 2 with six points, one ahead of South Africa who have played one game fewer
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zimbabwe crash out of the tournament after Netherlands defeat
India edged closer to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup
